description: From off- +â€Ž beat; not following the beat (e.g., of a drum that sounds out cadence).

adjectives.description: offbeat (comparative more offbeat, superlative most offbeat)

examples: He has such an offbeat sense of humor that hardly anyone finds his jokes amusing.
Synonyms: odd, peculiar, weird; see also Thesaurus:strange

entries.meaning: (music) The beats not normally accented in a measure.
examples: The congregation clapped along on the offbeat.

entries.meaning: (slang) An unconventional person, someone who does not follow the beat, who chooses not to conform.
examples: Synonyms: oddball, free spirit, heteroclite, individualist, nonconformist; see also Thesaurus:maverick, Thesaurus:strange person
